required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Verbal Instruction on Pelvic Floor Muscle Contraction in Post Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Verbal Instruction on Pelvic Floor Muscle Contraction in Post Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate which verbal instruction will lead to the most efficient contraction of pelvic floor muscles in post stroke patients. Pelvic floor muscle contraction will be evaluated via transabdominal ultrasound. ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock:
Sub-acute stroke patients during the rehabilitation period in the rehabilitation hospital will be examined. Each participant will be asked to contract the pelvic floor muscles using three different verbal instructions: (1) "contract your pelvic floor - all sphincters"; (2) "contract your anus"; (3) "contract your pelvic floor as if you're trying to stop urinating". Those who will not be able to contract will be taught by the ultrasound as a biofeedback.
The assessment of pelvic floor contraction will be measured by measuring bladder displacement via abdominal ultrasound. A curved linear array transducer will be placed in the transverse plane immediately suprapubically over the lower abdomen angled at 15-30 degrees from the vertical. An on screen caliper and measurement tool will be used to measure bladder displacement.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: all participants will receive the same verbal instruction

primary_outcome.measure: urinary bladder displacement in millimeters during verbal instructions
primary_outcome.description: bladder displacement will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound using the on screen caliper tool

secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire regarding symptoms of urinary incontinence,scale range 0-21 points. higher values represent worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: pelvic floor muscles endurance of contraction in seconds
secondary_outcome.description: time of muscle contraction will be measured during the last contraction in each instruction
assess and grade the functional status of a person based on the level of assistance he or she requires

arm_group.description: The participants will be verbal instructed to contract the pelvic floor muscle with the following sentences: (1) "contract your pelvic floor - all sphincters"; (2) "contract your anus"; (3) "contract your pelvic floor as if you're trying to stop urinating". Those who will not be able to contract will be taught by the ultrasound as a biofeedback.

intervention.description: Verbal instruction for pelvic floor contraction will be given to participants. Ultrasound examination will be conducted to asses urinary bladder displacement being a marker for pelvic floor muscle function.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- one to 6 months post first stroke
- understand the language and simple instruction
- willing to participate in the study
- mini mental assessment >21
Exclusion Criteria:
- Aphasia
- side neglect
- active urinary tract infection
- has been treated before for pelvic floor rehabilitation

facility.name: Leowenstein hospital, Department of Physical Therapy

results_reference.citation: Tibaek S, Jensen R, Lindskov G, Jensen M. Can quality of life be improved by pelvic floor muscle training in women with urinary incontinence after ischemic stroke? A randomised, controlled and blinded study. Int Urogynecol J Pelvic Floor Dysfunct. 2004 Mar-Apr;15(2):117-23; discussion 123. Epub 2004 Jan 31. Erratum in: Int Urogynecol J Pelvic Floor Dysfunct. 2008 Feb;19(2):311.

Shin DC, Shin SH, Lee MM, Lee KJ, Song CH. Pelvic floor muscle training for urinary incontinence in female stroke patients: a randomized, controlled and blinded trial. Clin Rehabil. 2016 Mar;30(3):259-67. doi: 10.1177/0269215515578695. Epub 2015 Apr 10.

Ben Ami N, Dar G. What is the most effective verbal instruction for correctly contracting the pelvic floor muscles? Neurourol Urodyn. 2018 Nov;37(8):2904-2910. doi: 10.1002/nau.23810. Epub 2018 Aug 28.

patient_data.ipd_description: the result of the study will be analysed. a paper will be submitted to international journal with study description including methods, examination protocol results.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: one year following completion of study
